008 *******************************************************************************/
009package _ImageJ_Examples;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.Roi;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import java.awt.Rectangle;
016
017/**
018 * This ImageJ plugin shows how an image operation can be confined
019 * to the currently selected region of interest (ROI). Note that
020 * it uses the ROI attached to the associated {@link ImagePlus} instance.
021 * The plugin works for RGB color images and merely inverts the
022 * each pixel contained in the ROI.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2020/12/17
026 */
027public class Roi_Processing_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
028
029        private ImagePlus im = null;
030
031        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
032                this.im = im;
033                return DOES_RGB + ROI_REQUIRED;
034        }
035
036        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
037                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
038                Rectangle bounds = roi.getBounds();
039
040                // ROI corner coordinates: 
041                int rLeft = bounds.x;
042                int rTop = bounds.y;
043                int rRight = rLeft + bounds.width;
044                int rBottom = rTop + bounds.height;
045
046                // process all pixels inside the ROI
047                for (int v = rTop; v < rBottom; v++) {
048                        for (int u = rLeft; u < rRight; u++) {
049                                if (roi.contains(u, v)) {
050                                        int p = ip.getPixel(u, v);
051                                        ip.putPixel(u, v, ~p);  // invert color values
052                                }
053
054                        }
055                }
056        }
057}
